001.desc: A large size storage box made with camphor wood, and exterior decorated with magpies on plum blossoms scene, enforced with straps of brass.

002.desc: Of rectangular form, naturalistically carved in bamboo-style with long nodded stalks forming the legs joined by openwork grape-ivy spandrels, graduated in size to fit within one another.

003.desc: Of rectangular top over four removable drawers, with applied incised arches and bail handles, the wood of a warm-brown color.

004.desc: Each of the rectangular forms, joined by openwork fruit spandrels, graduated in size to fit within one another.

005.desc: Comprising one rosewood square desk and two rosewood square chairs with stone panel inlaid.

006.desc: The desktop of a trapezoid shape with a red marble panel inlaid to the center, then with a drawer opening at the front center, overall of dark wood color.

007.desc: A box of Korean Tae Guk ginseng.

008.desc: The slightly everted rims rounded down to a short foot, painted to the interior with a figural story scene.

009.desc: Modeled with lobed sides simulating petals, carved with leafy vines to the domed cover against a yellow-glazed exterior, the interior modeled with a central circle compartment encircled by four radiating sections, applied to the interioroverall with a turquoise glaze.

010.desc: Worked from a celadon jade stone, carved as a crouching cat with its head looking upward, comes with a fit stand; with a Sotheby’s sticker at the bottom.

011.desc: The cylindrical body is set on top of three concave feet, incised around the body with dragons flying amidst clouds scene, paired with a domed wood cover with a seashell finial.

012.desc: Modeled with lobed sides simulating flower petals, painted to the top panel with a flower and bird scene.

013.desc: Worked from an opaque white jade stone.

014.desc: Carved as a pair of melons fruiting from leafy vines, worked from a creamy-ivory jade stone.

015.desc: Overall likely heart shape, carved two Chi dragons on top and bottom gazing at each other around the center aperture, the stone of overall grayish-white color.

016.desc: Comprising of one agate snuff bottle, of golden-brown color, and a gold splashed blue Peking glass snuff bottle.

017.desc: The stone is its naturalistic form, carved along its concave and convex with a landscape scene, the stone overall of an orange-yellow color.

018.desc: Each of hexagonal form, hollowed with one quatrefoil section to each face of the body, painted with immortal story scene to the exterior.

019.desc: Of cylindrical form, worked from a darkbrown wood, carved to the exterior with a landscape scene, with the author’s mark.

020.desc: Of slightly compressed cylindrical form, carved to the exterior with a figural scene and poetic phrases to the reverse.
